a.title: Northwest Early College ranks on U.S. News Best High Schools List

img.alt: Northwest Early College ranks on U.S. News Best High Schools List

a.title: Thank you Health Care Professionals and First Responders

img.alt: Thank you Health Care Professionals and First Responders

strong.span: BREAKFAST AND LUNCH CHANGE BEGINNING MARCH 30

p.span: In order to continue to protect your health, we are making adjustments to the breakfast and lunch schedule. We will be combining breakfast and lunch pick up to minimize contact. Bus delivery and curbside will still be available.

strong.span: CANUTILLO ISD TO REMAIN CLOSED UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

div.p: Canutillo ISD will now remain closed until further notice. However, online learning begins Monday, March 30! Visit our website to download the Remote Learning Toolkit.

strong.span: EL PASO CITY/COUNTY HEALTH AUTHORITY ISSUES “STAY HOME, WORK SAFE” ORDER

div.p: Stay home, work safe, stay healthy. Please comply with the city and county order to stop the spread of COVID-19. Do your part. Canutillo ISD will continue to provide essential food services and move forward with online learning preparation. See Order.

a.title: Northwest Early College ranks on U.S. News Best High Schools List

div.a: Northwest Early College ranks on U.S. News Best High Schools List
div.div: Northwest Early College High School stands among the top-ranked public high schools around the country.

a.title: Northwest Awarded College, Career Readiness Grant

div.a: Northwest Awarded College, Career Readiness Grant
div.div: TEA, through the Education Service Center Region 13, has awarded Northwest Early College with a $10,000 College and Career Readiness School Model sub-grant.

a.title: Rodriguez Tapped for National Advocacy Board

div.a: Rodriguez Tapped for National Advocacy Board
div.div: Canutillo ISD Trustee Armando Rodriguez was elected to serve on the National School Boards Action Center (NSBAC) Board.

a.title: Canutillo ISD making 3D printed face shields for District essential workers

div.a: Canutillo ISD making 3D printed face shields for District essential workers
div.div: Northwest Early College High School was given a challenge by the Canutillo ISD administration to help protect employees during the public health situation.

a.title: Northwest girls take over the computer science world

div.a: Northwest girls take over the computer science world
div.div: Girls at Northwest Early College High School are taking the computer science world by storm. In a field where boys usually dominate, the Northwest girls are changing the norm.

a.title: Kindness focus of students at school

div.a: Kindness focus of students at school
div.div: Kindness rules at Reyes Elementary. When it comes to safety, respect, and responsibility, kindness is an area of focus that students are being taught to start with at school this year.

a.title: Canutillo ISD Public Information Office wins 15 Awards

div.a: Canutillo ISD Public Information Office wins 15 Awards
div.div: The Canutillo ISD Public Information Office received 15 Texas School Public Relations Association Star Awards – including two Best in Category – for work done in promoting the District.

a.title: VITA provides FREE Income Tax Self-Preparation Support

div.a: VITA provides FREE Income Tax Self-Preparation Support
div.div: On-site IRS-certified volunteers will be available to prepare basic returns for families or individuals with a qualifying incomes.

a.title: Students at Northwest Early College host toy drive for local hospital

div.a: Students at Northwest Early College host toy drive for local hospital
div.div: The Interact Club of Northwest Early College High School, a service club of Rotary International, hosted a toy drive for patients at El Paso Children’s Hospital

a.title: Canutillo ISD strengthens security measures at all schools and buildings

div.a: Canutillo ISD strengthens security measures at all schools and buildings
div.div: Canutillo Independent School District has made recent upgrades to its security measures in keeping with the District’s priority to the safety of its students and staff.

p.span: Canutillo ISD has ten schools serving our 6,042 students. Click on an image to visit the campus website.
